intro: Psoralea phymatodes, commonly known as the woolly psoralea, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pale yellow to brown in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or rocky soils. Psoralea phymatodes is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
